meanings.definition: To offer or present for acceptance.
meanings.sent1: She proffered her hand in friendship.
meanings.sent2: He proffered his resignation to the company.
meanings.sent3: The magician proffered a bouquet of flowers from his hat.
meanings.sent4: The sun proffered its warm rays to the earth.
meanings.sent5: The waiter proffered a menu with a smile.

meanings.sent1: The proffer of a new job excited her.
meanings.sent2: His proffer of help was greatly appreciated.
meanings.sent3: The proffer of free ice cream drew a large crowd.
meanings.sent4: Her proffer of friendship was met with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The proffer of a scholarship changed his life.
